robot.collection

Class CollectionSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • robot.collection.CollectionSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class CollectionSystem
extends java.lang.Thread
    Positions the robot in such a way that it can collect the block then collects the block. Also deals with releasing the stack after the cage is full.
    Since:
    Version:
    1.1.0
    Author:
    Nathaniel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CollectionSystem(NXTRegulatedMotor cageMotor, Navigation nav)
      The collection system requires access to the motor controlling the cage in order to collect the block.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void collectBlock()
      Initiates the collection of a block (it is assumed that the block has been identified and is therefore fairly close to the robot.

      Return whether or not the robot has completed its task of collecting a block or releasing the entire stack.

      Lowers the cage (will be called before identification)

    • Constructor Detail

      • CollectionSystem

        public CollectionSystem(NXTRegulatedMotor cageMotor,
                Navigation nav)
        The collection system requires access to the motor controlling the cage in order to collect the block. It also requires the Navigation method in order to orient the robot properly so that the block can be collected.
        Parameters:
        cageMotor - - The motor controlling the cage/claw
        nav - - The Navigation class being used

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • collectBlock

        public void collectBlock()
        Initiates the collection of a block (it is assumed that the block has been identified and is therefore fairly close to the robot. However it is not necissarily oriented correctly.

      • releaseStack

        public void releaseStack()
        Tells the CollectionSystem to release the cages contents (i.e. opens and backs away) To be done at the end of the alloted time to place the stack in the stack zone. (or garbage in the garbage zone)

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Return whether or not the robot has completed its task of collecting a block or releasing the entire stack.
        Returns:
        boolean: done

      • raiseCage

        public void raiseCage()
        Lifts the cage (will be called on startup and after identification)

      • lowerCage

        public void lowerCage()
        Lowers the cage (will be called before identification)
